senses.sense_definition: A male given name, historically a shortened form of Gareth.

examples.text: My uncle <w>Garth</w> plays the guitar in a country band.
We decided to name the baby <w>Garth</w> after his grandfather.
Mr. <w>Garth</w> has been teaching history at the high school for twenty years.
The <w>Garth</w> family estate is located just outside the village.

senses.sense_definition: The name of various small villages and settlements, particularly in Wales and Scotland.

examples.text: They stopped in the quiet village of <w>Garth</w> during their tour of Wales.
The map indicates a small hamlet called <w>Garth</w> near the river.

senses.sense_definition: An enclosed yard or garden, especially a grassy quadrangle surrounded by the cloisters of a monastery.

examples.text: The monks walked silently around the <w>garth</w> during their morning meditation.
Sunlight illuminated the green grass of the cloister <w>garth</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A household or community group dedicated to the modern pagan faith of Heathenry.

examples.text: The local <w>garth</w> gathered in the forest to celebrate the winter solstice.
She was initiated into the <w>garth</w> after studying their traditions for a year.

senses.sense_definition: A dam or weir constructed in a river for catching fish.

examples.text: The fishermen checked the <w>garth</w> early in the morning for salmon.
Remains of an ancient stone <w>garth</w> can still be seen at low tide.
